p.k: A fascinating musical journey examining the back-to-basics pub rock movement that emerged in the south of England in the 1970s
An eye-opening look at the most memorable dance videos ever made, from Madonna's Vogue to Psy's Gangnam Style
From Baroque and Viennese Classicism to Romantic and the modern era, this series vividly brings to life the evolution of classical music
Series exploring some of the most intriguing and pricey pieces to pass through the world's greatest auction houses. A 1933 vintage car and Turner's Modern
Competition in which budding artists are challenged to paint a scene in four hours

Who's Got The Lady? When a piece of art is stolen, the gallery owner gets his girlfriend to make copies of it to sell. But did the work ever really leave the building?
The Skeleton Key A woman discovers a nasty side to her husband's personality when he goes into hospital before a holiday
76% Values Fascinating art pieces explore what it means to be British today, including a filmed poem from Simon Armitage

p.k: Melvyn Bragg looks back to his previous South Bank Show meeting with Billy Connolly and reflects on the Glaswegian's remarkable career in comedy
New. Film experts look back at the prolific career of Hungarian actor Peter Lorre, who gained international stardom for his portrayal of a psychotic

p.k: The late Robin Gibb and his brother Barry tell the extraordinary story of their family act, speaking candidly about their rise to fame and the tragedies

p.n: Laurel & Hardy: Their Lives and Magic
p.k: Behind-the-scenes documentary shedding new light on the exciting and turbulent private lives of Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy and the genuine friendship between them
An intimate portrait of American actor Robert Taylor. One of the most popular leading men of the 30s and 40s, he starred in films such as Magnificent Obsession and Bataan
A look at the life and career of American actor Montgomery Clift, who starred in films such as Red River, A Place in the Sun and From Here to Eternity

p.k: New. The fascinating story of Luciano Pavarotti's journey from concert performer to international superstar as he helped expand the popularity of opera worldwide
Filmed at Birmingham Symphony Hall, this special concert captures the illustrious Band of the Royal Air Force College on their annual tour
New. A magical in-depth exploration of the city of Paris, from the rich culture to the hidden rivalry between two districts - the rebellious Montmartre

p.k: New. A look into the fascinating fifty-year career of Josephine Baker, who rose to become an icon and a humanist fighter from a journey plagued by racism and tragedy
